basic.description: Simple procurement focused on essential needs fulfillment with minimal formalities and oversight, suitable for low-risk, low-complexity acquisitions.
activities: Identify essential needs and potential suppliers informally
Conduct basic negotiations and establish simple agreement
Perform minimal acceptance checks upon delivery

standard.description: Structured procurement emphasizing formal supplier evaluation, contract management, and performance monitoring, aligned with medium-risk projects requiring accountability.
activities: Develop formal RFP based on defined criteria
Evaluate suppliers using structured methods (e.g., weighted scoring)
Manage contract execution with milestone reviews
Conduct formal acceptance testing and verification
artifacts: Contract with milestones and performance clauses

comprehensive.description: Complex acquisition incorporating strategic planning, multi-faceted evaluations, and continuous risk management throughout the supplier lifecycle, ideal for high-stakes, high-complexity projects per ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288 and INCOSE best practices for transit/infrastructure where long-term supplier relationships impact system sustainment.
activities: Create strategic acquisition roadmap with risk profiling
Perform multi-criteria supplier evaluations including capability audits
Implement SLAs and continuous performance monitoring
Apply adaptive, risk-based acceptance with contingency planning
artifacts: Strategic acquisition plan with risk profiles
Multi-criteria supplier evaluation reports including audits
Comprehensive contract with SLAs and governance

basic.description: Basic proposal and delivery execution with confirmation of receipt, appropriate for straightforward supplier roles in low-complexity scenarios.
activities: Prepare essential proposal based on requirements

standard.description: Structured supply incorporating quality assurance in proposals and execution, suitable for projects requiring reliable delivery per industry standards like INCOSE guidelines for supply chain integration in infrastructure.
artifacts: Project execution plan with QA integration

comprehensive.description: Complex supply management with full lifecycle support, risk analysis, and performance optimization, aligned with advanced practices in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288 for high-reliability systems like transit where supply disruptions can affect operations.
activities: Execute detailed plans with embedded V&V

basic.description: Adoption of a standard lifecycle model with basic tailoring for immediate application, fitting small-scale projects with minimal customization needs.
activities: Document model usage and check basic compliance

standard.description: Maintenance of organizational model library with formal tailoring and assessment, supporting medium-scale projects per INCOSE recommendations for process maturity.

comprehensive.description: Comprehensive suite of lifecycle models with metrics-driven continuous improvement and certifications, essential for large infrastructure projects where lifecycle adaptability directly impacts cost and schedule per ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288.
artifacts: Multiple lifecycle models for different contexts

basic.description: Provision of basic infrastructure to meet immediate project needs with essential security, suitable for low-complexity environments.

standard.description: Structured management including tool qualification and performance monitoring, aligned with standard practices for medium-risk projects.

comprehensive.description: Strategic infrastructure planning with integrated tools, advanced security architecture, and predictive maintenance, critical for transit/infrastructure where downtime affects safety and operations per INCOSE and ISO standards.

basic.description: Basic project registration and prioritization with resource allocation for essential oversight.

standard.description: Structured portfolio planning with evaluation and tracking, suitable for balanced resource distribution in medium-scale operations.

comprehensive.description: Strategic optimization using advanced analytics and valuation models, vital for infrastructure portfolios where alignment with long-term goals drives value per INCOSE portfolio management practices.

basic.description: Basic skills identification and assignments for immediate team formation.

standard.description: Structured competency management with development planning for workforce growth.

comprehensive.description: Strategic workforce development including succession planning, essential for long-term infrastructure projects where skill gaps can delay delivery per INCOSE competency frameworks.

standard.description: Defined quality system with formal procedures and corrective actions, aligned with ISO 9001 basics.

comprehensive.description: Comprehensive, ISO-aligned quality management with risk-based planning and continuous improvement, critical for transit safety and reliability per INCOSE and infrastructure standards.
